## The Standard Model

::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:1.2em; font-weight:300; margin-top:40px;"}
The most successful theory (so far) of **fundamental interactions**
:::

::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:0.9em; margin-top:30px;"}
**Gauge principle:** <br>
Interactions arise by requiring invariance under local symmetry transformations.
:::


::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:0.9em; margin-top:10px; text-align:left"}
- **Electromagnetic** → $\mathrm{U}(1)_{\text{em}}$ <br> <span style="font-size:0.8em; color:gray;">acts on charged particles </span>
- **Weak** → $\mathrm{SU}(2)_L$ <br><span style="font-size:0.8em; color:gray;"> responsable of radioactive decays </span>
- **Strong** →  $\mathrm{SU}(3)_C$<br><span style="font-size:0.8em; color:gray;">binds quarks inside hadrons </span>  

:::
::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:0.9em; margin-top:10px;"}
$$\mathcal{L}_{\text{SM}} \;=\; \mathcal{L}_{\text{gauge}} + \mathcal{L}_{\text{matter}} + \mathcal{L}_{\text{Higgs}}$$
:::



::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:0.9em; font-style:italic; color:gray; margin-top:70px; text-align: right; "}
Gravity unfortunately is not included in the Standard Model.
:::

### Alert and Example Inline style

To emphasize specific words or text, you can:

- Use the default `.alert` class, e.g. [important note]{.alert}.
- Use the default `.example` class e.g. [For example, look at this text]{.example}

## Components

### Custom Inline Color Attributes

- Use inline `color` and `bg` attribute for custom color and background color, 
    - `[colored text]{color="#2a74f5"}` produce [colored text]{color="#2a74f5"}
    - `[text with background color]{bg="#f5e347"}` produce [text with background color]{bg="#f5e347"}
    - `[colored text with background]{color="#2a74f5" bg="#f5e347"}` produce [colored text]{color="#2a74f5" bg="#f5e347"}
- [Note that, when using inline attributes, DO NOT PUT SPACE on either side of equal (`=`) sign, that, write like `color="#2a74f5"`, instead of `color = "#2a74f5"`]{.alert}

# Callout Blocks

## Custom Blocks

There are three custom blocks that you can use. Create them using `.callout` class in a div (`:::`) and specify the type.

- For default block, use `type='default'`

- For alert block, use `type='alert'`

- For example block, use `type='example'`

## Default block

```{.markdown}
::: {.callout type='default'}
## Default block

This is a default block
:::
```

renders to,

::: {.callout type='default'}
## Default block

This is a default block
:::

## Alert Block

```{.markdown}
::: {.callout type='alert'}
## Alert Block

This is a alert block
:::
```

renders to, 

::: {.callout type='alert'}
## Alert Block

This is a alert block
:::


## Example Block

```{.markdown}
::: {.callout type='example'}
## Example Block

This is a example block
:::
```

renders to,

::: {.callout type='example'}
## Example Block

This is a example block
:::

const waitForReveal = setInterval(() => {
  if (typeof Reveal !== 'undefined') {
    console.log('Reveal.js is loaded');
    clearInterval(waitForReveal);

    // Evento per mostrare il frammento
    Reveal.on('fragmentshown', function(event) {
      if (event.fragment.dataset.fragmentIndex === "2") {
        const span = document.querySelector('.qc-text');
        span.classList.add('fade-to-qcd'); // Aggiunge la classe per l'animazione
      }
    });

    // Evento per nascondere il frammento
    Reveal.on('fragmenthidden', function(event) {
      if (event.fragment.dataset.fragmentIndex === "2") {
        const span = document.querySelector('.qc-text');
        span.classList.remove('fade-to-qcd'); // Rimuove la classe per l'animazione
        span.classList.remove('collapse-qcd'); // Rimuove la classe di collassamento
      }
    });

    // Evento per collassare in "QCD"
    Reveal.on('slidechanged', function(event) {
      const span = document.querySelector('.qc-text');
      if (event.indexh === 2) { // Cambia l'indice in base alla tua slide
        span.classList.add('collapse-qcd'); // Aggiunge la classe di collassamento
      }
    });
  }
}, 100);
</script>
